tool.name: SpectraMerger
tool.description: Merges spectra (each MS level separately), increasing S/N ratios.
tool.command:
@QUOTE_FOO@ @EXT_FOO@ #import re
## Preprocessing mkdir in && ln -s '$in' 'in/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $in.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($in.ext)' && mkdir out &&
## Main program call
set -o pipefail && @EXECUTABLE@ -write_ctd ./ && python3 '$__tool_directory__/fill_ctd.py' '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$args_json' '$hardcoded_json' && @EXECUTABLE@ -ini @EXECUTABLE@.ctd -in 'in/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $in.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($in.ext)' -out 'out/output.${gxy2omsext("mzml")}'
## Postprocessing && mv 'out/output.${gxy2omsext("mzml")}' '$out' #if "ctd_out_FLAG" in $OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS && mv '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$ctd_out' #end if

param.name: in
param.label: Input mzML file

param.name: merging_method
param.label: Method of merging which should be used

param.name: mz_binning_width
param.label: minimum m/z distance for two data points (profile data) or peaks (centroided data) to be considered distinct
param.help: Closer data points or peaks will be merged

param.name: mz_binning_width_unit
param.label: Unit in which the distance between two data points or peaks is given

param.name: sort_blocks
param.label: Sort blocks by <?> before merging them (useful for precursor order)

param.name: spectrum_type
param.label: Spectrum type of the MS level to be averaged

param.name: ms_level
param.label: Average spectra of this level

param.name: rt_FWHM
param.label: FWHM of Gauss curve in seconds to be averaged ove

param.name: cutoff
param.label: Intensity cutoff for Gaussian
param.help: The Gaussian RT profile decreases from 1 at its apex to 0 at infinity. Spectra for which the intensity of the Gaussian drops below the cutoff do not contribute to the average

param.name: spectrum_type
param.label: Spectrum type of the MS level to be averaged

param.name: ms_level
param.label: Average spectra of this level

param.name: rt_range
param.label: RT range to be averaged ove

param.name: rt_unit
param.label: Unit for RT range

param.name: ms_levels
param.label: Merge spectra of this level
param.help: All spectra with other MS levels remain untouched (space separated list, in order to allow for spaces in list items surround them by single quotes)

validator.message: a space separated list of integer values in the range 1: is required

expand.validator: len(value.split(' ')) == len([_ for _ in value.split(' ') if 1 <= int(_)])

param.name: rt_block_size
param.label: Maximum number of scans to be summed up

param.name: rt_max_length
param.label: Maximum RT size of the block in seconds (0.0 = no size restriction)

param.name: mz_tolerance
param.label: Max m/z distance of the precursor entries of two spectra to be merged in [Da]

param.name: rt_tolerance
param.label: Max RT distance of the precursor entries of two spectra to be merged in [s]

param.name: force
param.label: Overrides tool-specific checks

param.name: test
param.label: Enables the test mode (needed for internal use only)

param.name: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS
param.label: Optional outputs

data.name: ctd_out
data.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: ctd
data.filter: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS is not None and "ctd_out_FLAG" in OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS

tool.help:
Merges spectra (each MS level separately), increasing S/N ratios.
For more information, visit http://www.openms.de/doxygen/release/2.6.0/html/TOPP_SpectraMerger.html
